channel.title: Stories from slate.com - Digg
channel.description: Archive of the best slate.com stories on Digg including articles, videos, and photos

item.title: It's Actually A Great Time To Try To Sell A TV Show
item.description: How Hollywood is adapting to the pandemic.
item.kicker: TIME TO OPEN UP THE DRAFT FOLDER

item.title: In High School, I Fell For An Actress 25 Years My Senior. She Changed My Life
item.description: A hopeless teenage crush, an older actress and one extremely uninformed college decision.

item.title: The Subtle Ways Amazon Is Discouraging People From Ordering So Much Stuff
item.description: Strained by the pandemic, Amazon is now discouraging people from buying so much stuff.

item.title: We Need To Stop Obsessing Over 'The Curve'
item.description: The data doesn't tell the whole story of what's happening right now.

item.title: The Logistical Hell Of Postponing The Olympics For One Year
item.description: Pushing back the Tokyo Games requires so much, all in the face of an unpredictable pandemic.

item.title: 'Tiger King And I': Netflix's New Special Almost Offers A Corrective To The Documentary Series
item.description: Netflix's new special tosses its audience some juicy scraps, but it's there to whet appetites, not spoil them.

item.title: CSA And Local Produce Demands Are Skyrocketing, But Farmers Can't Keep Up
item.description: Farmers can't keep up with surging demand for local produce, but they're still struggling to replace lost revenue.

item.title: No, You Did Not Get COVID-19 In The Fall of 2019
item.description: Coronavirus arrived in the US in 2020. That illness you had in late 2019? definitely not coronavirus, despite claims made in a recent viral article.
item.kicker: CALIFORNIA HERD IMMUNITY ISN'T A THING

item.description: The student already has a prestigious clerkship lined up with a federal appeals court judge.

item.title: Can Pets Contract The Coronavirus? What About The Tiger?
item.description: Here's what to do if your cat starts coughing.

item.title: We're On The Brink Of Cyberpunk
item.description: The real future may be more Amazon and less androids, but the dystopian power dynamics are hard to miss.

item.title: The Long History Behind The 5G Coronavirus Conspiracy Theory
item.description: "Before every pandemic of the last 150 years, there was a quantum leap in the electrification of the Earth."

item.title: 'It Was Gone Overnight': One Restaurant's Struggle To Weather The Pandemic
item.description: Eric Wang first noticed something was wrong on March 9.

item.title: Meet Rocco. He Owns A Dairy Queen. The Government's Flawed Coronavirus Plan Might Not Save It
item.description: Why the small-business rescue isn't going to rescue some businesses.

item.title: After 9/11, America Rallied Behind New York. Not This Time
item.description: The last time New York was the center of a catastrophe, America rallied behind it. The nation's reaction to its coronavirus outbreak is a different story.

item.title: An Art Exhibit You Can Visit Without Leaving Your Couch
item.description: The creators of the Whitney Museum's New York Apartment explain how they combined thousands of listings into a website for one massive, $43.9 billion dwelling.

item.title: Coronavirus Diaries: Screw It, We Got A Dog
item.description: We had to act quickly.

item.title: We're All Living On The Cruise Ship Now
item.description: Some of us get the privilege of cabin fever. Others bring room service.
item.kicker: COULD BE A WHOLE LOT WORSE

item.title: My Family Owns A Grocery Store. The Supply Chain Is A Real Problem
item.description: "Our stores haven't gotten a frozen load in two stores in two and a half weeks. And I haven't seen toilet paper in a while."

item.title: My Family Owns A Grocery Store. The Supply Chain Is A Real Problem
item.description: "If I could get some frozen in, I would be super happy. And I haven't seen toilet paper in a while."

item.title: How Listening To Musicals Is Getting Me Through The Pandemic
item.description: Musicals have been there in hard times before. We need them now.

item.title: How To Defuse The Coronavirus Prison System Time Bomb
item.description: We are on the verge of catastrophe — for incarcerated persons, staff, and their families, obviously, but also for the general public.

item.title: The Key Stat In The NYTimes' Piece About Losing Your Sense Of Smell Was Wrong
item.description: COVID-19 might cause anosmia, but so does any upper respiratory infection.

item.title: The New Stimulus Bill Gives Unemployed Workers An Extra $600 Per Week. That's Huge
item.description: Democrats negotiated a big bump in unemployment insurance.

item.title: How Do We Know If We're Doing The Right Thing?
item.description: For the most part, people have absorbed that it is critical we all do the right thing during the coronavirus pandemic. But what is the right thing? And how long do we have to do it for?

item.title: I've Struggled With Schizophrenia, And This Pandemic Is Messing With My Sense Of Reality
item.description: The widespread shuttering of businesses, the sense that everyone's discussing the same thing all the time — it's particularly disorienting for me.

item.title: Joint Account
item.description: I thought I was outsmarting the algorithm, but I was really outsmarting my own social media habits.

item.title: Once Again, Florida Waited Too Long
item.description: The state is an expert at sticking its head in the sand.

item.title: I'm A Flight Attendant For A Major Airline. Boy, My Passengers Are Weird Now
item.description: They've started to give me too much information.

item.title: In A Time Of Crisis, A Panicked Nation Comes Together To Watch Nu-Metal Band Trapt Melt Down On Twitter.
item.description: You've almost certainly heard their 2002 hit single "Headstrong." It's what the band was best known for — until yesterday.

item.title: How To Work From Home With Your Partner And Stay Sane During Coronavirus
item.description: Some of these behaviors seem obvious, but they may not come easily.

item.description: We need to help these people right now.

item.title: What I Learned About Self-Quarantine From Nine Months Of Chemotherapy
item.description: Your life will begin to feel like Groundhog Day.

item.title: It's Impossible To File For Unemployment In A Lot Of States Right Now
item.description: Thousands of Americans have been laid off from restaurants and other businesses, but employment benefits websites are crashing.

item.title: Why Should We Give The Airlines A Bailout?
item.description: They made a fortune over the past decade. Now they're demanding $50 billion to stay in business.

item.title: How To Use Psychology To Convince People To Take Social Distancing Seriously
item.description: Taking advantage of social norms may help you get through to someone in denial about the severity of the coronavirus.

item.title: How Editors From Mexico, India And The UAE Are Covering The Coronavirus
item.description: The rumors about the coronavirus vary by country and region, but they seem to exist everywhere.

item.title: The Groceries That No One Wants To Panic-Buy
item.description: Americans are emptying their supermarkets of everything but these persistently unappealing products.

item.description: Slate's guide to the seven races everyone is talking about this week.

item.title: Researchers Find HPV Vaccine Trials Put Safety On The Back Burner
item.description: Anyone looking for quick conclusions can stop reading now — though the findings don't currently affect official recommendations to get vaccinated.

item.title: What 8,000 Prisoners Think About American Politics
item.description: In a first-of-its-kind survey, we asked the most disenfranchised people in America who they would vote for and what matters to them.

item.title: Free Speech Isn't A Free Pass For Privacy Violations
item.description: Classifying something as "speech" is only the first step in First Amendment analysis.

item.title: The Robber Bank
item.description: It's hard to believe that so much thieving has gone unpunished and unchecked for so long, which raises the question: Can America ever rid itself of Wells Fargo?

item.title: When You Get A Devastating Diagnosis At 27
item.description: There are options for a man who doesn't know how to move forward. American Ninja Warrior is one.

item.title: COVID-19 Isn't As Deadly As We Think
item.description: Don't hoard masks and food. Figure out how to help seniors and the immunosuppressed stay healthy.

item.title: Here Are Some Things Joe Biden Has Said On His March To The Front Of The Democratic Primary Field
item.description: Let's get to know our new Democratic frontrunner, in his own words.

item.title: I Tried Not To Touch My Face For A Day
item.description: What happened when I took the CDC's advice for avoiding the coronavirus as literally as possible.

item.title: I Had The Coronavirus. This Was The Worst Part
item.description: I first got sick on Valentine's Day. I never thought it would be this.

item.title: Is Aging A Disease?
item.description: Whether aging can be cured or not, there are arguments for thinking about it like a disease. But there are major pitfalls, too.

item.title: Choose Your Own Adventure Books Spread Conservative, Neoliberal Ideology To 1980s Kids, According To A Historian Of Capitalism
item.description: A new study exposes how the iconic '80s series taught a generation that individual choice is everything and failure is always your fault.
